As he looks out over the countryside that surrounds him, George begins to reflect on his own life, and the series of challenges and setbacks that it has faced. In this moment of reflection, George finds himself thinking about the idea of "what if?" - i.e., the hypothetical scenario of what would have happened if certain events had not occurred (or at least not been as severe or catastrophic as they ultimately were).
